intro: Racosperma auricomum, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and full sun. Racosperma auricomum is often used in landscaping and is a symbol of Australian national identity.
